skill.name: ghe-requirements
skill.description: This skill should be used when creating, updating, linking, or versioning requirements for GitHub Elements threads. Use when user mentions requirements, specs, REQ files, or when starting feature development. Provides the requirements folder structure, versioning system, and SERENA backup protocols.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when creating, updating, linking, or versioning requirements for GitHub El...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidelines for requirements management. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged documentation syntax (markdown backticks, version strings, bash examples in code blocks) as security issues. No executable code, network calls, or malicious patterns exist. All 73 findings are false positives.

content.value_statement: Projects struggle with disconnected requirements that drift from implementation. This skill enforces structured requirements management with version tracking, template enforcement, and automatic SERENA backup to keep specifications aligned throughout the development lifecycle.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured REQ markdown files with standardized template format
Links requirements to GitHub issues with automatic status tracking
Backs up requirements to SERENA memory bank for persistence
Validates requirements linkage before DEV phase begins
Organizes requirements by epic and wave structure
limitations: Does not execute bash commands - provides documentation only
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not generate code implementations from requirements
Does not validate test coverage automatically

use_cases.title: Enforce Requirements Standards
use_cases.description: Create standardized requirements with templates that all team members must follow for consistent documentation.

use_cases.title: Link Work to Specifications
use_cases.description: Start feature development by linking to approved requirements, ensuring implementation matches user expectations.

use_cases.title: Verify Acceptance Criteria
use_cases.description: Check that requirements contain testable acceptance criteria before development begins.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Requirement
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new requirements file for [FEATURE NAME] in epic [N] wave [W]. The feature should [BRIEF DESCRIPTION].

prompt_templates.title: Version Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update REQ-[XXX] from version [X.Y.Z] to [X.Y.Z+1] because [REASON]. Document the changes in the revision history.

prompt_templates.title: Link to Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a DEV thread for REQ-[XXX] and link the requirements file in the issue body with current version and acceptance criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Review REQ-[XXX] for completeness. Verify it has user story, acceptance criteria, technical requirements, atomic changes, and test requirements defined.

output_examples.input: Create a requirements file for a user authentication feature
output: Using standard template with user story, acceptance criteria, and technical requirements
Status set to draft - requires approval before DEV phase

output_examples.input: Version update for REQ-042 with new acceptance criteria
output: Bumping version from 1.0.0 to 2.0.0 (major - breaking AC change)
Updated revision history with change description
Notified all linked issues of the update

best_practices: Always get requirements approved before starting DEV phase work
Update requirements version when acceptance criteria change (major bump)
Link every DEV thread to its primary requirement file
anti_patterns: Starting development without linking to approved requirements
Modifying acceptance criteria without versioning the requirement

faq.question: How is requirement versioning different from code versioning?
faq.answer: Requirements use semantic versioning where major bumps indicate breaking acceptance criteria changes.

faq.question: What happens if requirements change during development?
faq.answer: Update the requirement file, bump the version, and notify all linked issues.

faq.question: Can I create requirements without epics or waves?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the standalone folder for independent requirements not part of any epic-wave structure.

faq.question: How does SERENA backup work?
faq.answer: Requirements are copied to .serena/memories/requirements/ for persistent memory bank storage.

faq.question: What validation commands are available?
faq.answer: Check requirements linked in issue, verify file exists, and compare linked version against current file.

faq.question: How does this integrate with thread managers?
faq.answer: Hephaestus verifies requirements before claiming, Artemis checks tests match requirements.
